intro: Ferula coskunii, commonly known as the Turkish cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in umbel-like clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Ferula coskunii is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
